LOLA OS Documentation

Welcome to the official documentation for LOLA OS (Layered Orchestration for Logic and Automation), an open-source Python framework for building Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM)-native AI agents. This documentation covers the TMVP 1 release (v1.0.0), providing a mocked prototype with core abstractions, agent templates, tools, CLI, examples, and more.

Getting Started

Start with the Quickstart Guide to install LOLA OS and run your first agent.

Table of Contents

:maxdepth: 2

quickstart
concepts/core
tutorials/build_your_first_agent
tutorials/building_onchain_tools

Overview

LOLA OS enables developers to create AI agents with EVM-native capabilities, adhering to principles of Developer Sovereignty, EVM-Native, Radical Reliability, Choice by Design, and Explicit over Implicit. Key features include:

  • Core Abstractions: Modular agent, graph, state, and memory management.

  • Agent Templates: ReAct, PlanExecute, and Collaborative agents.

  • Tools: Web search, EVM contract calls, human-in-the-loop, and more.

  • Examples: Research Agent and Onchain Analyst.

Contributing

Contributions are welcome! See the Contributing Guide for details on how to get involved.
